definition: funny man (lead role in comic dialogue 對口相聲|对口相声[dui4 kou3 xiang4 sheng1])/to joke/to play the fool/to provoke laughter
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
funny/amusing/sth comical
old variant of 狠[hen3]/old variant of 很[hen3]/also used as an exclamation of anger

sentences.english: A boy ran so quickly that many other children were running after him.
sentences.chinese: 一个男孩跑得很快，许多别的小孩逗哏在它后面跑。

definition: straight man (supporting role in comic dialogue 對口相聲|对口相声[dui4 kou3 xiang4 sheng1])/to react with exasperation to the silliness of the funny man 逗哏[dou4 gen2]
comic crosstalk/formalized comic dialogue between two stand-up comics: funny man 逗哏[dou4 gen2] and straight man 捧哏[peng3 gen2]
comic dialogue/sketch/crosstalk
comic monologue/one-person comic sketch
(of a comedian) to seize on something sb has just said or done to make an ad lib joke
Ma Sanli (1914-2003), Chinese comedian
folk theater consisting of recitation accompanied by clapper board rhythm
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
short, simple literary or artistic creation/essay/skit
clown role in opera/clown/buffoon
popular comedian/comic star
genre of song-and-dance duet popular in northeast China
to praise an actor/adulation
announce the items on a (theatrical) program
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
clapper talk/patter song (in opera) with clapperboard accompaniment
